definition: two-faced person/double-dealing
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: I knew that I am a genuine double-dealer.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，我才是一个真正的两面派。

sentences.english: The die-hards of today are precisely such double-dealers.
sentences.chinese: 现在的顽固分子，就是这种两面派。

sentences.english: Mrs Reding said Paris had been duplicitous in its dealings with the European authorities.
sentences.chinese: 瑞丁女士称法国在此事的处理上对欧盟大搞两面派。

sentences.english: And so the game of deceit and double-dealing continued.
sentences.chinese: 因此这个欺骗和两面派的游戏继续进行了下去。
欺骗性的或两面派的手法。

sentences.english: We make a distinction between such people with a dual character and the traitors and pro-Japanese elements.
sentences.chinese: 将这种两面派分子，和汉奸亲日派加以区别。

sentences.english: Two-faced people are usually back stabbers.
sentences.chinese: 两面派也通常都会在别人背后下刀子。

sentences.english: "You say I did a volte-face, but we are going back many years now, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “你会说我是两面派，但我们早已走上正轨，”他说。

sentences.english: How do counter-revolutionaries employ their double-dealing tactics?
sentences.chinese: 反革命分子怎样耍两面派手法呢？

sentences.english: Double-dealers will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 耍两面派终归不会有好下场。

definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
one who tries never to offend anybody
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
hypocrite
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
schemer/conspirator
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
behind sb's back
hypocritical
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话
